Description: Foot fragment of Attic pottery neck-amphora; pale slip, glaze fired reddish-brown; reserved underside and resting surface; inscription incised on inside of floor after the vessel had been broken.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Published in: D. G. Hogarth, H. L. Lorimer & C. C. Edgar, Naukratis 1903, Journal of Hellenic Studies, vol. 25 (1905), p. 116, fig. 2, no. 37. Johnston 2008, 115-6. See also: D. W. J. Gill, Two Herodotean dedications from Naucratis, Journal of Hellenic Studies, vol. 106 (1986), p. 185, note 5.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 709, no. 680)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0900)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
